Japanese: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中真剣

/pとアンマリーが
倒した、あの人形だが……
English: /p and Anne-Marie defeated that mech, but...

Japanese:
形状をみる限り、
オートマンを率いていたという
人形王に間違いない。
English: From what we can tell by the look of things, there's no doubt that that was the Mech King who's been leading the Automen.

Japanese: メリッサ＿ちょっとした驚き

English: It's as we thought!

Japanese:
王が倒されたことで、
オートマンの軍団は撤退したよ。
世界各地でな。
English: After the King was defeated, the Automen armies began to retreat. All over the world.

Japanese:
人形都市も
活動を休止して、
防衛モードに移行した。
English: The Mech City has also suspended it's activities and switched to defence mode.

Japanese:
よかった。
世界は救われたね。
English:
That's good.
Looks like the world's been saved.
Yeah.

Japanese: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中苦しい
あの人形を調べてみたが……
English: I tried examining that mech...

Japanese:
恐ろしいシロモノだ。
まさしく世界最強……。
English:
It was a frightening thing.
There's no doubt that it's the strongest in the world...

Japanese:
我々の技術の
はるか先をいっている。
まさに神の技だ。
English: Our technology is far behind it. Just like some divine craft.

Japanese:
それに勝ったんだから、
アンマリーと/pは
たいした腕だよ。
English: However, as the victors, Anne-Marie and /p are also incredibly skilled.
That's true.

Japanese:
だが、あの人形……
おそらく未完成だ。
English:
But, that mech...
It seems likely that it was incomplete.

Japanese:
もしまた人形都市が
動き始めたら……
English: If the Mech City starts to move again...

Japanese:
きっと、
完全な人形王を作り上げる
だろう。
English: They'll undoubtedly work to construct a perfected Mech King.
The war wages on.
As long as the Mech City remains standing.

Japanese:
次に人形王と出会うとき……
やつは想像をこえた強さを
発揮するはずだ。
English:
The next time we meet the Mech King...
He'll demonstrate a strength beyond our understanding.

Japanese:
完成した人形王に勝てる
マリオネーションギアは……
English: Against the completed Mech King, our Marionation Gear won't stand a chance...
Yes.

Japanese: メリッサ＿戦闘中軽い驚きＬ

English: ...No way...

Japanese:
親方。
まあ、そう暗い顔すんなって。
English:
Boss.
Well, if you say if with such a dark look, then it will come true.

Japanese: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中真剣

English: Kay and /p, eh?
Were you listening in?

Japanese:
ああ。
そう悲観することも
ないと思うぜ。
English:
Yeah.
Though, I don't think there's any need to be so pessimistic.

Japanese: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中真剣

English: What makes you say that?

Japanese:
人形都市が活動を再開するには、
まだ時間があるんだろ？
English: There's still time before the Mech City starts to resume it's activities, isn't there?

Japanese:
だったら、その間に、
こっちもすごい人形を
手に入れればいいんだよ。
English: Then, in the meantime, we'd better get our hands on an awesome mech on our side too.

Japanese:
世界を旅して、
八工房を回ろうぜ。
English: Let's travel around the world and stop by the Hachi Workshops.

Japanese:
何も、ファウストだけが
天才じゃない。
English: You never know, Faust can't be the only genius in the world.

Japanese:
八工房の作るマリオネーション
ギアの中には、ファウストの人
形より強いのが、きっとあるさ。
English: Amongst the Hachi Workshops, there must be a Marionation Gear that's tougher than Faust's mech.
Isn't that right?

Japanese: ガロイ親方＿戦闘中真剣

English: Pfft!
Bwa hah hah hah.
Well, you're not wrong.

Japanese:
あんたたちには、
かなわないねぇ。
English: I just can't win against you lot.

Japanese:
よし、
まずはどこから行くかな？
English: Right then, where are you planning to head first?

Japanese:
射撃型が得意な/c5弾工房/c3。
忍者型の人形を作る/c5忍工房/c3
もいいよな。
English: The /c5Bullet Workshop/c3 specialise in sharpshooters. The ninja-type mechs at the /c5Shinobi Workshop/c3 are also good.

Japanese:
まずは、
マリオネーションギア協会に
行って情報を集めようぜ。
English: But first, we should go to the Marionation Gear Association to get some more info.
Now, let's get going.

Japanese: 運転は私にまかせなよ。
English: You can leave the driving to me.

Japanese:
世界の果てまでだって
連れてってやるよ。
English: I'll take you to the ends of the world if need be.

Japanese:
お前らがいない間、
俺とアンマリーが
この工房を守る。
English: Whilst you're gone, Anne-Marie and I will protect this workshop.

Japanese:
お前らは留守を気にせず、
好きなところに行ってこい。
English: Don't worry about being away, go anywhere you want.
